com.yourmediashelf.fedora.client.request
Class FedoraRequest<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.yourmediashelf.fedora.client.request.FedoraRequest<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddDatastream, BatchDeleteDatastreams, BatchGetDatastreams, DescribeRepository, Export, FindObjects, GetDatastream, GetDatastreamDissemination, GetDatastreamHistory, GetDatastreams, GetDissemination, GetNextPID, GetObjectHistory, GetObjectProfile, GetObjectXML, Ingest, ListDatastreams, ListMethods, ModifyDatastream, ModifyObject, PurgeDatastream, PurgeObject, RelationshipsRequest, RiSearch, Upload, Validate
public abstract class FedoraRequest<T>
extends Object

Base class for Fedora REST API requests.

Author:
Edwin Shin

Method Detail

public FedoraResponse execute()
                       throws FedoraClientException

Executes this request against the DEFAULT_CLIENT

Returns:
the FedoraResponse to this request
Throws:
FedoraClientException - if DEFAULT_CLIENT is null

setDefaultClient

public static void setDefaultClient(FedoraClient client)
Set the instance of FedoraClient that all FedoraRequests should use by default.

Parameters:
client - the instance of FedoraClient that requests should use by default

isDefaultClientSet

public static boolean isDefaultClientSet()
Return boolean indicating whether DEFAULT_CLIENT has been set.

Returns:
boolean

execute

public abstract <F extends FedoraResponse> FedoraResponse execute(FedoraClient fedora)
                                throws FedoraClientException

Execute this request using the supplied FedoraClient instance.

Parameters:
fedora - an instance of FedoraClient
Returns:
the response
Throws:
FedoraClientException - if the HTTP status code of the response is >= 400.

xParam

public T xParam(String key,
                String value)

Add an arbitrary query parameter and value to the method.

This method is intended as mild future-proofing, allowing fedora-client to be used with future or unreleased versions of Fedora that may support additional or different query parameters than fedora-client is aware of.

Parameters:
key - the query parameter name
value - the value
Returns:
this builder

getHeaders

public javax.ws.rs.core.MultivaluedMap<String,String> getHeaders()
Retrieves the current HTTP headers set on this request.

Returns:
A MultivaluedMap of HTTP headers.

setHeaders

public void setHeaders(javax.ws.rs.core.MultivaluedMap<String,String> headers)
Sets the current HTTP headers on this request. This overwrites any headers already set.

Parameters:
headers - A MultivaluedMap of HTTP headers.

addHeader

public void addHeader(String key,
                      String value)
Adds an HTTP header to this request. This does not overwrite any headers of the same name already set: it adds to them.

Parameters:
key - The name of the HTTP header to set.
value - The value of the HTTP header to set.

removeHeader

public void removeHeader(String key)
Removes all HTTP headers of a specified name to this request.

Parameters:
key - The name of the HTTP header to remove.

protected com.sun.jersey.api.client.WebResource resource()
                                                  throws FedoraClientException

Returns a WebResource as supplied by the DEFAULT_CLIENT using FedoraClient.resource(). Also adds any headers as found via getHeaders() to the resource.

Returns:
WebResource
Throws:
FedoraClientException - if DEFAULT_CLIENT is null
